definition: mnemonic chant/rhyme for remembering (arithmetic tables, character stroke order etc)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)

sentences.english: The little Indians were murmuring incantations and showing off their beautiful costumes in jumps.
sentences.chinese: 小印第安人念着口訣，一跳一跳的展示着美麗服裝。

sentences.english: So, I need uh some kind of a pith instructions from a skilled bike rider.
sentences.chinese: 因此我需要從一個熟練的單車手那裏獲得口訣指示。

sentences.english: And pith instructions are really, really valuable.
sentences.chinese: 精要口訣是非常非常珍貴的。

sentences.english: Unfortunately the wolf demon had cheated little monkey of the pithy formula .
sentences.chinese: 但老狼已經從小猴口中騙取了馬蘭花的口訣。

sentences.english: Students even do not have to remember the multiplication table.
sentences.chinese: 他們在學乘法時，居然也不讓學生背“乘法口訣表”。

sentences.english: Instead, use memory tricks to remember them.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，使用記心口訣記住他們。

definition: to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
